chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshuaa R. Aragon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshuaa R. Aragon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshuaa R. Aragon was found guilty of Operate w/o Carrying License. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshuaa R. Aragon

records.addlTxt:
8:47 AM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshuaa R. Aragon in court.  Attorney Gregory Bates in court for Joshuaa R. Aragon. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM315/22CM49/21CT700. Matter is resolved and agreement placed on the record.

21CT700: State amends count 1 to ordinance of 343.18(1) - No DL on Person. Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court.  Court orders a forfeiture plus costs totaling $263.50, due in 90 days or 5 days KCJ/work crew. On motion of State, count 2 is dismissed.

22CM315: State amends count 1 to ordinance of 343.18(1) - No DL on Person. Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court.  Court orders a forfeiture plus costs totaling $263.50, due in 90 days or 5 days KCJ/work crew. On motion of State, counts 2-3 are dismissed.

22CM49: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 2 and 3; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, count 1 is dismissed. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders a $150 fine plus costs on both counts 2 and 3, DNA surcharges ordered; 90 days to pay or 12 days KCJ or work crew on each count.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample, notice given to def. in court.
Final pre-trial on September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Email received from defense counsel - not avail on 8/19; FPT ajd to 9/29 @ 8:30am.  No objection by the State

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  21CT700/22CM49/22CM315.  Judge Dreyfus acting for Branch 3.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Deft appeared along w/Atty Greg Bates.  Defense requests an adjournment; discovery which was received from Joint Services does not even pertain to this deft.  Attys will contact Joint Services to work out the discovery snafu.  FPT set for 8/19/22 @ 9am.

Minutes:  21CT700/22CM49/22CM315.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Deft appeared along w/Atty Greg Bates.  Defense counsel reports the deft recently lost his employment; deft is unable to pay his advocate counsel fees.  Deft reached out to SPD's office regarding representation; deft needs to provide documents to SPD's office before they will re-evaluate the deft.  Court is not inclined to allow a subst. of counsel at this time.  Court will address payment of advocate counsel fees at a later date.  Atty Bates requests add'l time to speak with the deft regarding the offer and review discovery with deft.  Discussion held.  Court will conduct ludwig hrg today.  Court takes a short recess to allow Atty Bates to confer w/his client.  Court reconvenes.  Atty Bates requests add'l time.  JS to remain on for 6/13/22 @ 9am.  Parties to notify the court by 5pm the Wed prior to trial if resolved.
Jury selection on June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on May 5, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Minutes:  22CM315/22CM49/21CT700.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Deft filed a petition for advocate counsel.  Deft briefly questioned by the Court.  Court grants the deft's petition for advocate counsel.  Deft will have to repay advocate counsel fees at the rate of $50/mo commencing 5/1/22.   NTBS of FPT/JS dates.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.

01:31 to 01:34 PM  
  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Francesco Balistrieri.  Clerk PT  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 09:00 am w/ other files 21CT700, 22CM49.  $250  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).    jk
and witness list filed by the State  kmk
